intro: Tryphostemma harmsianum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to some animals, including humans. The species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
